posts.cooked:
If Signal is all about privacy then why is there no option to control who can see your DP & About. Isn‚Äôt this contradictory to Signal‚Äôs philosophy of Privacy? Why is profile sharing mandatory to initiate a conversation?
(WhatsApp has this feature since ages. Many of my friends complained about this & left Signal.)

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: Profiles are only shared with contacts. You have to explicitly grant permission to share profiles with non-contacts.

posts.name: MORTAL ENGINE
posts.cooked: What if I don‚Äôt want to share with a few of my contacts? Where‚Äôs the privacy control?

From the support pages:

Is sharing my Signal Profile required?

Yes, sharing your profile is required to continue chats.

Signal Support

Signal Profiles and Message Requests

Signal Profiles and Message Requests let people know who's messaging them. Read more: Signal Profiles Learn more Edit your Profile Profiles Blog Post Message Requests What is my Signal Profil...

This does not answer the Why? but explains the feature.

I think this feature request is relevant and could be of interest:

Improved profile sharing controls Feature Requests
There have been multiple requests that revolve around profile sharing controls, and while they are all slightly different, they have a significant amount of overlap and result in duplicate discussions. Due to the timespan of the threads and related discussion, rather than a confusing merge of all the posts, I am simply going to close the other topics and link them here. Any discussion relating to profile sharing can be continued in this topic.

Also this related one that could be a potential workaround, if implemented:

Multiple separate user profiles / multiple identites! (for example - but not exclusive to - dual sim phones) Feature Requests
In short: Suggestion to allow for multiple seperate (user) profiles within Signal Priavate Messenger. Either one for each SIM for dual Sim phones, or any number of user defined profiles to which a conversation can assigned. This is a suggestion for a feature which other messenging apps seem to not have put any effort in yet. Therefore, implementing this might also give signal an edge and some publicity. But besides that its just something some of us expected would be standard in 2018. Need to‚Ä¶

This feels lack of privacy. One has to at least share something to initiate a conversation, right? For that I‚Äôm fine with sharing Profile Name only but not with DP & About. I‚Äôve no issue with making Profile Name sharing mandatory.
Any contact saved on my address book has access to my profile but What if I want to exclude some of contacts from having access to my profile or certain aspect of my profile like DP & About? Do I need to delete those contacts from address book? Can they access my profile even If I delete their contacts?

posts.name: MORTAL ENGINE
posts.cooked:
Why share everything even with contacts?
Suppose I‚Äôve in my contact - Plumber, Mechanic, Shop Owner, Electrician, Government Official, etc. I don‚Äôt want my profile to be shared with them but I do need to keep their contact in my address book.
Because Signal is not a social media platform yet. It is a messaging client and service.

11 Screenshot_2025-06-11-10-28-42-249_org.thoughtcrime.securesms1080√ó2311 115 KB

Signal should be more specific about how one‚Äôs profile pic & about is shared/interacted with contacts or non-contacts by default.

I think they should rephrase it like this or something better to clarify - ‚ÄúBy default your profile is shared with your contacts, groups and non-contact people you message. And any changes to your profile will be visible to them.‚Äù

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: this is just saying the exact same thing with the more words.

Just for your information (sorry if you already knew this, but it sounds a little bit like you might not), signal contacts are not equivalent to phone contacts.

People in your address book (phone contacts) only become signal contacts if you start a signal conversation with them. While your signal contacts can see your info, your phone contacts can not, i.e. if you just put your plumber‚Äôs number into your phone‚Äôs contacts they will not see your signal profile. Only if you engage with them on signal will they then be able to see it. And if you want them to no longer see your info, you can currently achieve this by blocking them on signal or, yes, removing them from your signal contacts list.

I agree that it would be nice to have multiple throwaway profiles for different signal contacts, but that is probably difficult to implement, so I don‚Äôt have much hope.

I think the issue is that, while there is a look-up-table to find the corresponding user ID for a username, there is no implementation for the other direction. If signal were to implement multiple usernames per ID, they would most likely want to put a limit on the number of usernames, to keep storage costs within certain limits and to prevent attacks aiming to fill up their storage capacities. This limit can not currently be enforced, because that would require implementation to look up all usernames corresponding to one ID. And building this would require a lot of storage and pose a privacy risk in return.

posts.name: MORTAL ENGINE
posts.cooked:
Understandable.
Yet I think they should and can add Privacy settings for DP & About even though Signal isn‚Äôt a social media yet (Neither should it be). Throwaway profile will be more difficult to implement + will be not easy to use for the masses, I guess. Having simple, straight forward control will be better IMO. Signal is known to offer ‚Äúthe best user privacy with highest level of user friendliness with no security compromises.‚Äù

STORIES PRIVACY OPTION Screenshot_2025-06-11-23-50-09-640_org.thoughtcrime.securesms1080√ó760 46.9 KB

Since Signal Stories have control option for - with whom (Signal Contacts) you want to share your stories, I think it‚Äôll be possible to add option for DP & About too. Will it be bad to have such privacy options? I do know nothing about the technical difficulties though. That‚Äôs just my two cents.

there‚Äôs rephrasing for clarity, there‚Äôs ChatGPT-eque ‚Äúmake it longer‚Äù. notice that you‚Äôre not even using different words. who is your profile shared with? contacts, groups, and people you message.
you just changed ‚Äúand changes to it‚Äù to a full sentence and added a ‚Äúby default‚Äù, which implies you can change it (not the case right now).

I think this should be a must too.
Usernames allows us to connect with other people without disclosing our phone number. What if I want to keep private my profile picture too?

I want to talk with my family and that they can see me in my profile picture, but I don‚Äôt want that with the people I share my username with.

This issue should be reopened.
